Description: Fragment of lip, neck and oval handle to sharp turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip. Circular stamp with rose symbol.
Production date: 131 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Name Nikasagoras. Probably from the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 092.27.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (195)
